content.description: Central Perk, Ross, Chandler, and Phoebe are there. Joey is working.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, remember when I had a monkey?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, what, what was I thinking?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! So, what’s with the 20 percent tip? Did I do something wrong?
content.parenthetical: he’s just picked up their bill

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Twenty percent is a pretty generous tip Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what’s more generous than that?! Fifty percent! Y’know what’s even more generous than that?!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I see where you’re goin’!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s up with the greed Joe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, look I’m sorry you guys, but it’s just that I gotta get these new head shots made. And they’re really expensive, y’know? I’m down to like three! Well, actually two ‘cause one of ‘em I kinda blackened in some teeth—Why did I do that?! (Hits himself in the head.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well isn’t there something you can do to earn a little extra money? I mean, can’t-can’t you pick up, I don’t know, an extra shift here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or, y’know, I used to beg for money. Of course it helps if you’ve got y’know a little of this (she sticks her chest out and shakes it) goin’ on. Wow! I still have it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, wait! Wait! Don’t you have an audition today? Yeah! Maybe you’ll get that job!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, ha-ha-ha! Ooh! Wait a minute, I used to get medical experiments down on me all the time!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, finally an explanation.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no! I used to get paid for all kinds of medical stuff, remember? Let’s see uh, well I don’t want to donate sperm again. (To Ross) I really prefer doing that at the home office y’know? (Ross nods his head.) Ooh-ooh, maybe they want like some of my blood or-or spit or something, huh?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Joey!
content.parenthetical: approaching with a tray with an order on it

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: What did I tell you about talking to your friends while you’re working?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh do it?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: That guy (points) has been waiting for his coffee for ten minutes! He’s complained about you three times! (He hands the coffee cup to Joey, assuming that Joey will deliver it and walks away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, where was I? (Takes a sip of the coffee.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is there as Phoebe and Rachel enter wearing workout clothes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what have you guys been up to?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! We went to a self-defense class today!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, kicking a guy in the crotch all morning really takes it out of ya!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Takes it out of you? (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now, we can kick anybody’s ass!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: After one class? I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? You wanna see me self-defend myself?! Go over there (points) and pretend you’re a sexual predator! Go on! I dare ya!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, of course you can defend yourself from an attack you know is coming, that’s not enough. Look, I studying kara-tay for a long time, and there’s a concept you should really be familiar with. It’s what the Japanese call (he holds two fingers up to his temple, and he does this every time he says this word) unagi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Isn’t that a kind of sushi?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s a concept!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah it is! It is! It’s freshwater eel!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, maybe it means that too…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! I would kill for a salmon skin roll right now!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? Fine! Get attacked! I don’t even care!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on Ross. We’re sorry. Please tell us what it is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Unagi is a state of total awareness. Okay? Only by achieving true unagi can you be prepared for any danger that may befall you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You mean in case someone is trying to steal your bamboo sleeping mat or your kettle of fish?
(Rachel laughs and Ross mocks her.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All I’m saying is, it’s one thing being prepared for an attack against like each other; whole another story being prepared for an attack, I don’t know, like a (turns and puts his face close to Rachel’s and screams) surprise !!
(Rachel calmly wipes the spittle off her face.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, you know that one was coming, but that doesn’t mean you have unagi. (Does the finger thing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh! Y’know what? If we made reservations, we could have unagi in about a half-hour.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what… (Moves away as Chandler enters, panicked.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-hey, is Monica here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, look I need your help, I don’t know what to get her for Valentine’s Day.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, Valentine’s Day was like two weeks ago, so I wouldn’t get her a calendar!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She was working on Valentine’s Day so we’re celebrating it tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, hey! Why don’t you book a date for both of you at one of those romantic spas?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, Joey, that’s actually a really good idea!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And of course, crotchless panties.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well appealing as that does sound to her boyfriend (pause) and her brother, (the camera pans to Ross flashing Joey a very evil look; Joey gets scared) I can’t do that we promised we’d make each other gifts this year.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aw, I love that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You can’t make crotchless panties? You take, you take a pair of scissors and you just cut…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay-okay-okay! So, making things. That sounds like so much fun.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I thought so to until I paper mached one of my eyes shut.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I love paper mache! What did you make?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I made a… (Does one of those gibberish words.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What is that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So what are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, have you guys made anything that maybe I can take credit for?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! I have! I have! I started making these little sock bunnies! (She takes out a sock that’s been made into a bunny with eyes, nose, mouth, whiskers, and two other socks sown onto it for ears.) Oh for crying out loud!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, wait a minute! That is my sock!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now, it’s you little bunny friend. (She sticks it in Rachel’s face and they both laugh.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is desperately trying to make his Valentine’s Day gift. He takes a paper cup, turns it upside down, sticks two pencils into the top, and hangs a coat hanger from the bottom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This, this actually is a… (Does the same gibberish word from before.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Honey, can I ask you a question about the Valentine’s Day gifts?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do we have to make the entire thing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Why, did you—you forget to make yours?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Of course, of course not. I just have to uh, go over to the place where I-I made it and pick-pick it up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (They kiss.) Okay, I can’t wait! This is going to be the best Valentine’s Day ever! (Chandler giggles and exits.) I can’t believe it! Make the presents! Make the presents!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m just so excited to make the presents! (Chandler does another sarcastic/scared laugh and leaves.) Shoot!

content.description: A Medical Research Office, Joey is there to sign up for an experiment, any experiment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi uh, I’m Joey Tribbiani and with all do respect I’d like to donate some fluids.

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: We’re actually at the end of one of our research cycles, so we’re not looking for applicants right now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh that’s too bad. I’ve kinda been saving up. (She just looks at him in horror.) Uh, are you sure there’s no studies I can participate in?

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: Well, here’s a schedule of what’s coming up. (Hands it to him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks. (Starts to read it.) Well but this one starts now. (Points to one.)

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: Oh that one is available now, but only identical twins are eligible. It’s a twins study.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But it’s $2,000.

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well how about this one? Testing the effects of Joey Tribbiani on attractive nurse receptionists.

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: We already got the results back on that on, and they’re not good. (Joey beats a hasty retreat.)

content.description: The Hallway between the Apartments, Ross is hiding behind that bump out on Monica’s side waiting for Phoebe and Rachel. As they come up the stairs, he jumps out and yells…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: DANGER !!! DANGER !!!!!
(They both scream and jump away.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What the hell was that?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A lesson in the importance of unagi. (He starts doing the finger thing every time now.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, you’re a freak !!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Perhaps. Now I’m curious, at what point during those girlish screams would you have begun to kick my ass?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, so we weren’t pre pared!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry I had to take such drastic measures to make my point, but I—look, I just want you guys to be safe. (Monica comes out to throw out the garbage and Ross screams…) DANGER !!!!! (She completely ignores him and keeps walking.) Ahhh, huh? Unagi.

content.description: Cole-Geddes Casting Agency, Joey is there on his audition and thinking about that 2,000 bucks for the twins study.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: 2,000 bucks is a lot of money. Oh, I wish I had a twin. Where could I find someone who looks exactly like me? (The camera widens its shot to reveal a room full of Joey look-a-likes. Joey looks at the guy next to him and then back at his script.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is coming in from doing his laundry. He starts folding it as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler. I sensed it was you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Unagi. I’m always aware.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, are you aware unagi (does the finger thing) is an eel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t figure out what to make Monica.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, why don’t you make her one of your little jokes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m going crazy! Okay? Do you have any thing around here that looks homemade?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? She’d-she’d love this. (Picks up a model of the Saturn V rocket, that’s the one that took man to the moon.) Uh, it’s an exact replica of Apollo 8. I made it in the sixth grade.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I guess I could use that. I could say that your love sends me to the moon.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah-yeah, except Apollo 8 didn’t actually land on the moon. But you-you-you could write that umm, your love lets me orbit the moon twice and return safely. (Apollo 8 was the first one that orbited the moon and the one that read the Christmas Story from the orbit of the moon on Christmas Eve, 1968. They also took the famous Earthrise picture of the Earth rising over the moon.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute, I can’t give this to her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because it says “Captain Ross” on the side and “I hate Monica” on the bottom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.
(Chandler leaves dejectedly. When the door closes Rachel and Phoebe jump out from behind the curtains and scream…)

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: DANGER !!!!!
(Ross screams like a little girl.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahhhhh, salmon skin roll. (She does the finger thing.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, he’s still trying to figure out what to make Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Okay. (He goes to the closet, moves the clothes out of the way, and notices an empty hanger. He takes the empty hanger and bends it all out of shape. Then he holds it out as if he’s giving it to her.) Yes honey, I made it myself. (He throws it down and goes to her chest, grabs something, goes to the bed table, and takes out a pair of scissors. He turns around and holds the scissors to the crotch of the panties he just removed.) I can’t do it. I can’t do it. (He throws them both down and continues looking. He opens another closet door and finds a tape.) Oh! Oh! A mixed tape! A mixed tape!! (He runs out into the living room.)
[Cut to the living room, Chandler is entering as Monica finishes wrapping her present for him on the kitchen table.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Hi! You uh, ready to exchange gifts?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure! Okay, you go first.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, come here! Come here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! (She takes her present for him and they move over to sit on the couch.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now, it’s not wrapped because I just, just finished it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But I made you a tape of what I think are all romantic songs.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, what a great gift! Is The Way You Look Tonight on it?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe we’ll have to listen and see!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I love it! Thank you so much!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, you ready to open yours?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
(He opens his present to find Phoebe’s sock bunny from earlier.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a sock bunny.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah-yeah, you remember how I call you bunny?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not really.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I did one time, and-and I want to start doing it more. See that’s what this is about.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I see. Y’know umm, Phoebe makes sock bunnies.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No, she doesn’t. Uh Phoebe, what she makes—that’s uh—they’re sock rabbits. They are completely different—Okay! Okay! Okay! I didn’t make it! I’m sorry! I totally forgot about tonight and the fact that we’re supposed to make the presents!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it’s okay. I don’t…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no, it’s not okay! It’s not! I mean you were just… You’re so incredible! You went through all this time and effort to make this tape for me! Y’know I’m just gonna—I, I am gonna make this up to you! I will! I-I am going to cook anything you want in here (points to the kitchen), and I am going to do anything you want in there! (Points to the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I did put a lot of thought in the tape. (They both run into the bedroom.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, they are relaxing in sexual bliss.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! (To the sock bunny still on his hand.) You are way to young to have seen that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oops! (Covers its eyes.) Y’know, your birthday is in a month-and-a-half, what do you say I forget to get you a present for that too?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are totally and completely 100% forgiven.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We have got to wash that! (Referring to the sock bunny.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! (Takes it off his hand and throws it behind the night-stand.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you remember that jacket that you love so much, that you thought was too expensive?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You have done enough!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wanna wake up early and go get it for you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No you don’t—get it in black, not brown.
(The oven dings.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oop, your cake is ready!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oop!
(They both get out of bed and go get some cake.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s like that old saying, have some sex, eat some cake.
(As they approach the kitchen, the door opens and in walks in a Joey look-a-like.)

content.speaker: Joey’s Look-A-Like
content.text: Hey Mon! Hey Chann! (He goes to the fridge) Just gettin’ a soda! (Does so.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who the hell are you?!

content.speaker: Joey’s Look-A-Like
content.text: I’m Joey! How are you doin’?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! No! No! No! How you doin’?! How you doin’—Damnit Carl! Go wait in the hall! (Goes into the hall.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I got to apologize on the behalf of Carl.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who the hell is Carl?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, did I not mention? Carl is a guy I hired to be my identical twin for a medical research project.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know sometimes the good ideas are just right in front of you, aren’t they?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, I know it sounds crazy, but I think it might work. Y’know? The only problem is, Carl’s acting is… (Does the international hand symbol for so-so.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The only problem!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, he’s the reason I didn’t get that big Minute Maid commercial a couple of years ago remember? We were supposed to be brothers, but he messed it up.

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: Hey, uh can I get a little piece of that cake?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pizza!! We like Pizza!! Get out!!! (Carl does so.)

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Rachel are returning.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Pat Sajak?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yep!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alex Trebek?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, of course!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chuck Woolery?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Definitely! Phoebe, you will not find a single game show host, who’s ass I cannot kick.
(They start to walk into the living room and notice someone’s head sticking up from behind a chair. The camera cuts to the other side and we see it’s Ross.)

[Time lapse. The girls have Ross pinned face down. Phoebe is sitting on his back and arms while holding his head down and facing Rachel. Rachel is sitting on his knees and holding his lower legs vertically, causing Ross pain.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Say it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Say we are unagi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s not something you are! It’s something you have!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Say it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? I can easily get out of this, but there is a chance you can get very, very hurt!
(Rachel yanks on his legs again and he groans in pain.)

content.description: The Medical Research office, Joey is there with Carl in the waiting room. Two identical twins come out and both wave by at the same time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right Carl, we’re next. Now remember, what is not gonna be?

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: Another Minute Maid fiasco.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right! And what are you not gonna do?

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: Well, I’m not gonna talk because…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damnit Carl! (Carl goes to say something more, and Joey silences him with a grunt.)

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: (To the receptionist) Can I have the next one please? (Takes the form.) Joey and Tony Tribbiani. (Joey and Carl stand up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s us.

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: But uh, this is a study for identical twins.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right, $2,000.

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: But, you’re not identical twins.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damnit Carl!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is getting ready for Chandler’s arrival. He enters and finds the place lit with candles and dinner on the table.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my good God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Continuing the countdown of your favorite meals. Tonight, No. 3, macaroni and cheese with cut up hot dogs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, you have done enough! Okay? You have to stop this now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I will! But not tonight. For dinner music, I thought we could listen to that tape you made me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, the mixed tape.
(Monica pushes play and The Way You Look Tonight starts to play.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The Way You Look Tonight is on here! Dance with me?
(He hesitates, then goes over to dance with her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are just the sweetest. (They kiss.)
(Suddenly, a strange and familiar voice comes out of the tape player. Here’s a hint, OH…MY…GAWD!! That’s right, it’s Janice!)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I love the way you look every night Chandler! (Monica breaks the kiss and Chandler freezes in terror.) That’s why I made you this tape! Happy Birthday! Love Janice!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! You’re the sweetest! (He tries to kiss her but Monica backs away with a look that could kill on her face.)

content.description: A women’s self-defense class, the instructor is just finishing a class.

content.speaker: The Instructor
content.text: Okay ladies, that ends today’s class, and let’s remember, let’s be safe out there.
(The women all clap and start to leave as Ross comes up to the instructor. Apparently he was hiding in the back.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a great class.

content.speaker: The Instructor
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah, I was watching. (The instructor just nods and walks away.) Umm, hey, a couple of questions though. Umm, about that-that-that last move where the woman tripped you and then pinned you to the floor, what-what-what-what would you do next?

content.speaker: The Instructor
content.text: Well, she would take her keys and try to jam them…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No-no. No. What would you do next?

content.speaker: The Instructor
content.text: Who? Me the attacker?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes that’s right.

content.speaker: The Instructor
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I tired attacking two women, did not work.

content.speaker: The Instructor
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I mean it’s okay, I mean, they’re-they’re my friends. In fact, I-I-I was married to one of them.

content.speaker: The Instructor
content.text: Let me get this straight man, you attacked your ex-wife?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no! No-no! No, I tired! But I couldn’t. That’s why I’m here. Maybe we could attack them together? (He glares at him.) That-that’s a no.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is trying to explain himself to Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am so, so, so, so sorry!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I will cook anything you want in here (points to the kitchen), and do anything in there! (Points to the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah you will! (Points to the bedroom) And, are you kiddin’ me?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on Monica, it’s our Valentine’s Day. Please? Please-please, please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Janice’s Voice
content.text: My funny valentine, sweet comic valentine! You make me high over my heart!
(Monica breaks the hug and starts for the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, are we going in there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am!! (Enter her room and closes the door behind her.)

content.speaker: Janice’s Voice
content.text: You’re look for laughable… (She does the now patented Janice laugh.)

content.description: The street in front of Central Perk, Ross is walking up and sees two women that look like Phoebe and Rachel from behind.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah-ha, nowhere to run! (He starts to run towards them.)
[Cut to Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are sitting up by the window because two guys have their couch.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t like sitting up here! I’m just gonna over… (She starts to get up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No Rachel! They got here first!

(Ross appears at the window behind them crouched behind a garbage can and ready to spring his attack on who he thinks are Phoebe and Rachel. The camera cuts to the exterior view and Phoebe and Rachel call the shots from inside.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why is Ross doing that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: DANGER !!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Why is he jumping on those women!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We should help him!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I… Well, I don’t think they need any help.

(Ross starts to scream and run away. He stops in front of the window of Central Perk to check the pursuit and notices Phoebe and Rachel inside looking at him. He mouths, “What?” Then realizes that the women he attacked are closing in so he screams and runs away.)
